Boat racing is just a concept a the moment. I dont think it will get of the ground any time soon. But you can expect more leagues to open soon. We cant open another Formula K straight away after this season is over, so the new stuff will serve as filler while we open season 2 of the GP.

It will all take place on Kerbin though. Everyone is welcome to suggest potential locations we can use around the home planet for rally leagues. Dont worry about specific layouts for now, just neat locations would be nice.

Also, we will eventually expand into The 3rd Dimension with the KerrBull League, in more ways than one :-)

We're not calling it KerrBull, by the way. I hate the Formula One team, so no. Sorry.

Other planets is too much of a hassle. Keeping it on Kerbin is so much simpler.

AviationLights will be mandatory, not so much as brake lights but flashing rear lights. Usually used for wet weather, now used because they look cool.

Brake lights will not be mandatory for Formula K.

Boats: not soon.

Rally: once Formula K S1 is finished, this and a few others will be opened. One by GROOV3ST3R, one by me. (Maybe)

Trucks: definite yes. Kerbals love big things that have a chance of exploding.

NEWS: I'm thinking: Karts, micro trike racing, racecross (like rallycross but instead of dirt and tarmac, AIR and tarmac.
So racecross is a plane based race?.... Or jumps...? Sounds good either way.

NEWS: I'm thinking: Karts
Your thinking karts! Yes, please karts, now I can have a game where I can kart in a computer and not in real life!

Other planets is too much of a hassle. Keeping it on Kerbin is so much simpler.

You only need to get the rover to the other planet once though. Land, keep the rover docked. Logout. Log back in, resume the game, teleport to your lander. After running a lap, revert to 'launch.' Instead of taking you to the launchpad, it'll take you to your landing site where you can just deploy the rover again.

I've been doing this already on the current track so I waste less time between runs.

The KerrBull League originally has nothing to do with cars. It was meant to be a plane racing league. It can expand to stunt racing, motocross and obstacle runs later on with vehicles. But at its core, it would be a plane racing league.

Don't know what you have against RedBull team since they are one of the best teams in F1. Preferences and tastes I guess. Though the design rules for F1 cars are flying in the face of aesthetics and aerodynamics... 2014 Will be one hell of an ugly season.

If not KerrBull, then what shjould it be called? Aeris-I Aerobatics? Thats sort of the best I can come up with, since I forgot the name of the tournament in DreamWorks Planes movie.

Regardless, there are no planned extra terrestrial tournaments any time soon. You will have enough challenges to deal with on Kerbin alone. Having to transport your vehicle of choice to another celestial body seems like an incredible waste of resources and time.

Also, as much as brake lights will not be required on Formula K cars, they will be mandatory on trucks and buggies as well as possible touring cars or nas-cars. Basically any future league vehicle which will be classed as Road Legal.

Karting, thats probably the whackiest and most fun league there is strap a seat to some cubic struts and put on some small rover wheels and you have a bona fide death trap xD

Randomness, try lowering your graphics settings. If that doesn't work, hide all unnecessary lines in persistent trails and remove all crafts except your car from space center. You can also change your physics delta time see if that helps. What's your computer like anyway? Chances are its running lots of stuff in the background which lowers your overall performance.

I too was wondering about possible lag issues. I can't imagine what other drivers are doing that I'm not and could actually shave off a whole 15 seconds from the time. I tried a LOT of different configurations. With or without spoilers. With only the front. With only the back. RCS tank in the center. Thrusters in front. Thrusters in back. Straight wheels, cambered wheels. Differing chassis. None of it made a difference of more than 2 seconds at best.
